reading--sample-taken: {0} sample taken within an area of {1} block(s)
config--description--durability-cost: The amount of durability damage to take for each sample
config--description--sample-size-cube: The size of the sampled area. This area is a cube, centered on the sampled block
config--description--sample-size-cuboid: The size of the sampled area. This area is a cuboid, centered on the sampled block and stretching from the mantle to the world height
config--description--direction: If enabled and allowed by the server, adds the direction of the reading to the output, in addition to distance / quantity
config--description--marker: If enabled and allowed by the server, automatically creates a map marker for column and long-range distance and quantity samples
config--description--direction-allowed: If enabled, allows players to enable reading direction output in their client configuration
config--description--direction-threshold: The number of blocks within which not to add a direction, to reduce visual clutter for already-visible blocks
config--description--marker-allowed: If enabled, allows players to enable automatic marker creation in their client configuration
config--description--marker-threshold: The minimum distance between 2 different map markers, to reduce map clutter for adjacent readings
config--description--simplified: If enabled, only requires 1 sample to output the density readings. Will still consume the equivalent of 3 samples of durability
config--description--ordering-enabled: If enabled, the readings are ordered by the block name, distance or quantity, depending on the mode
